meanings.sent1: Leaves left on the ground too long start festering and smell bad.
meanings.sent2: If you don't clean a wound properly, it can start festering.
meanings.sent3: The forgotten sandwich in my backpack was festering with mold by the end of the week.
meanings.sent4: Negativity can fester in your mind if you don't address it.
meanings.sent5: The garbage was left to fester in the hot sun, creating a terrible stench.

meanings.sent1: The festering fruit attracted flies to the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: The festering smell coming from the dumpster was unbearable.
meanings.sent3: The festering pile of laundry in the corner needed immediate attention.
meanings.sent4: The festering relationship between the two friends finally came to an end.
meanings.sent5: The festering wound on his arm needed urgent medical care.

meanings.definition: (noun) a sore or wound that is infected and inflamed
meanings.sent1: The doctor cleaned the festering on the patient's leg.
meanings.sent2: The festering on the dog's paw needed to be treated by the vet.
meanings.sent3: The festering on the old pirate's leg was a result of a battle injury.
meanings.sent4: The festering on the tree trunk attracted insects and birds.
meanings.sent5: The festering on the wound was a sign of a serious infection.
